replies.commentBody:
If Trump conspired with Russia to win the election (which is still unproven, but looking more and more certain), there's treason there. But the person who committed treason is Trump by conspiring, not Obama by exposing it.

I fully expect Trump to declare it treason to expose his treason, though. And I fully expect most Republicans to buy it.

comments.commentBody: 4 years ago President Obama laughed at the thought that Russia was our biggest Geopolitical threat? Now he has changed his mind because Hillary was an awful candidate for President. If Obama is actively trying to undermine our government, that is treason and he should be investigated starting now. He had 8 years to hate the United States but failed to bring the majority of the country with him. Hate against the USA or it's government and trying to topple the government is an act of treason. Vote in 4 years if you don't like America being great again. I love the USA!!!

The key to all of this is Trump's tax returns. Why haven't the Democrats in Congress become united in a public campaign to pressure Trump to release them? If they lead, public demonstrations will follow, especially after more damning information is released via leaks. Paint Trump as the chief obstructor of justice.

Incredible that Donald is still president and that his cabinet is full of law breakers. Sessions must be fired and all of the other contacts detailed in the Guardian Newspaper must be investigated. This cannot happen under Sessions and Comey.

Do Republicans care at all about this country? You sure can't be sure given what they knew! And thank you President Obama for caring about the country over politics. You are sorely missed!

I am amazed at the denial by the Trump supporters.

Manafort, Flynn, Carter Page, Sessions, Tillerson, Wilbur Ross's role in Russian $ laundering Bank of Cyprus, and the kind words to Putin are more than just coincidence and circumstantial.

Common sense should tell you as much, but that may not exist in Trumpland.

Can't POTUS Trump get rights to the Beatles "Back in the USSR" to replace "Hail to the Chief"?

I'm certain if it has to go through the House and Senate, the votes are there.

"However, Justice officials acknowledged that Mr. Sessions had spoken with Mr. Kislyak twice: once, among a group of ambassadors who approached him at a Heritage Foundation event during the Republican National Convention in Cleveland in July and, separately, in an office meeting on Sept. 8. The contacts were first reported by The Washington Post."

Yes, my friends, and do we know who runs the Heritage Foundation? Why, yes we do! It is Charles and David Koch.

President Obama is just plain pure gold in character, thought, and action. It will b a very long time, if ever, we see his kind again.

Thank you President Obama. Only God knows what you may have prevented.

replies.commentBody:
The actual emails weren't terribly embarrassing. They were widely misrepresented as being far more damaging than they should have been (and they WERE more damaging, since a lot of not-so-bright voters just read the headlines and the hype).

In other words, we got to see Trump as he really was, but Clinton as a caricatured villain.

comments.commentBody:
No one is upset when Trump got "hacked" when someone released that Billy Bush tape, or when someone sent the NY Times his taxes. That's all fair play and part of the process.
But if Podesta was that stupid to have his account password as "password," then perhaps it's better he didn't get into the white house?
Also... the elections weren't hacked. The dems were hacked and truthful, embarrassing, and incriminating information was made public, just like Trump To hear Hillary was fed debate questions is sickening... to hear the way they cheated to keep Bernie down is sickening...
Americans got to see both candidates in more detail than the candidates wanted and they made their decision on who to vote for.

replies.commentBody:
Preserving evidence of treason only undermines traitors.

And perhaps I'm old fashioned, but if Trump's a traitor (which is not yet proven, but looking more and more certain), I sort of feel that he should be undermined.

comments.commentBody:
This is a little unprecedented? A former President deliberately undermining his successor? Are we surprised? We're becoming more like a third world country everyday. I'd say it's about time President Trump unleash the hounds on Barrach and Hillary?

Maybe that's what it's about, blackmail? You leave my scandals alone, I'll stop pursuing yours.

replies.commentBody:
The Russians certainly released DNC emails, though the way they did it was the furthest thing from transparency, as they were spun as if they were far worse than they really were, and many voters bought the spin without investigating further. They misrepresented those emails specifically to elect Trump.

The accusation now isn't that Russians did that. We know they did. The accusation, which seems more and more certain, is that Trump's campaign knew they did and conspired with them to do so. That would be treason.

The fact that you'd try to conflate the two makes me dubious of your claim to have been a lifelong Democrat and not a Trump supporter.

They misrepresented those emails specifically to elect Trump.

The accusation now isn't that Russians did that. We know they did. The accusation, which seems more and more certain, is that Trump's campaign knew they did and conspired with them to do so. That would be treason.

The fact that you'd try to conflate the two makes me dubious of your claim to have been a lifelong Democrat and not a Trump supporter.

comments.commentBody:
I weep for America. That the CIA and the "Deep State" could mislead the country in such a dangerous and audacious way is truly a tragedy. I am a lifelong Democrat and a Liberal progressive, and I NEVER would have thought that I could be persuaded to side with Trump, but here we are.
There is no evidence of Russian "rigging" of elections. Trump is a businessmen, and Russia has been open for business since 1990. As far as I now, there does not exist a state of war between Russia and the US. Not yet,anyway. But what saddens me most is what the Russians are actually accused of doing -- namely, providing transparency. If indeed the Russians were responsible for the WikiLeaks disclosures, we owe them a debt of gratitude, because those leaks allowed us to catch a glimpse of the corruption, the illicit and quasi-criminal activity of the Clinton campaign and the DNC. But no one is talking about the substance of those leaks - it's all about HOW they were leaked.
And yet, when Trump tries to raise a fuss about the "illegal leaks" about Gen. Flynn, everyone dismisses him, saying that in this case, the content of the leaks is important, regardless of provenance.
My God, the Democrats are as despicable as they are spineless, and so is the MSM.

The stock market soared yesterday because the coup-ists among H. Clinton, Obama etc are perceived to be on the wane. These people dislike the USA and have contempt for citizens. They view the government and other world organizations as organs to be used to support their person extracurricular social and financial activities.

We are in a civil war. Disloyal elites, who detest the American electoral system and the American voters generally, are attempting a coup to take over the USA and reassert their global dominance.
Trump vowed to "drain the swamp". Instead, other than himself as the most scurrilous, he is filling the swamp with the likes of Jeff Sessions.

President Washington didn't ever tell a lie.

President Nixon didn't ever tell the truth

president trump* doesn't know the difference.

replies.commentBody: Yes no doubt they think evidence is undermining.

comments.commentBody: Did you know that the right has a totally different spin on this story? Calling it proof that Obama undermined the Trump administration: http://dailycaller.com/2017/03/01/confirmed-obama-sabotaged-trumps-trans...

The article indicates that foreign intelligence agencies are also in possession of information about the contacts beteeen Trump surrogates and Russians.

Perhaps a few of those agencies can make public statements about such contacts if they can protect their methods and sources.

Those foreigners are not Republicans or Democrats. Their information is not "political" in the US. They do that interception to try to prevent becoming victims of the Russians themselves.
